site.title: Natalia & Bart's Wedding
site.description: Join us for our special day on June 14, 2025 in Semarang, Indonesia

hero.invitation: We're getting married and we'd love for you to join us on our special day

bart.description: Bart grew up in Mariënvelde, a small town of 900 people located in 'de Achterhoek' (translated as 'the back corner'), where he enjoyed a peaceful and worry-free youth. He grew up with one older sister and parents running a workshop. Bart was brought up possessing an entrepreneurial mindset, Bart studied to become an electrical engineer. After some years in corporate life, he decided that wasn't for him, and Bart traveled the world, where he discovered his true passion. He moved to Bali in 2022 to work on a startup and has been permanently based there since 2023, pursuing his dream.

natalia.description: Natalia was born and raised in Semarang, the capital city of Central Java, with a population of 1.7 million citizens. As the youngest of three siblings, with two older brothers, she experienced a warm family life. Natalia pursued her academic interests by studying to become an accountant. Seeking professional growth after her studies, she moved to West Java to work for a prominent property development company. Driven by a desire for new challenges and experiences, Natalia made the move to Bali in 2021. Deeply rooted in her upbringing, she embraces Javanese wisdom and holds a strong sense of pride in her rich Javanese culture.

travel.title: Travel & Accommodation
travel.intro: We're excited to welcome you to Semarang, Indonesia for our wedding celebration. Below you'll find information to help you plan your trip and make your stay comfortable.

byAir.title: By Air
byAir.description: The closest airport is Ahmad Yani International Airport (SRG) in Semarang. For international travelers, you may need to connect through Jakarta (CGK) or Bali (DPS) airports.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The local currency is Indonesian Rupiah (IDR). ATMs are widely available, and major credit cards are accepted at hotels and larger establishments. It's good to have some cash for smaller vendors and transportation.

language.title: Language
language.description: Bahasa Indonesia is the official language, with Javanese being widely spoken in Semarang. English is spoken in tourist areas and major hotels. We'll provide a small phrasebook in your welcome package.
